blog.name: huntress-of-the-forest
blog.title: The Bisexual Buccaneer From Both-Ways Bay
blog.description:
Hi, Holly here! If you haven’t guessed from the title, im bisexual and Polyamorous. She/her and they/them please. I love fantasy, and am a big critical role fan. I also like overwatch, star wars, and similar things.

Come say hi!

tags: i don't know how to spell it so i'll tag it twice
summary: so I’ve recently seen a post going around about Beau’s little brother having been kidnapped by the Xhorhasians and, I’m not here...
body:
so I’ve recently seen a post going around about Beau’s little brother having been kidnapped by the Xhorhasians and, I’m not here to dispute the kidnapping, but the kidnappers. So strap in folks, because I’m about to drop a theory I’ve had since we heard Caleb’s backstory. 

tw: everything involved in Caleb’s backstory

Picture this. You are the archmage of civil influence *cough* propaganda *cough*. You’re Trent Ikithon and an evil son of a bitch. And suddenly, the mages you work with have come back with an object that can control time. Not truly, but once a day, those that have it can change one thing. And you are fascinated. Imagine what your weapons could do with the power to wield time? An enemy hit attacks them? Rewind! Their own attack misses? Rewind! So you start dedicating your weapons to this- and also, start sending them into Xhorhas to find more. 

A few Xhorhasians come and break into the Empire, but you don’t let them get far. It’s like they don’t even try. And they’re just giving you fodder for their own demise- “the xhorhasians are breaking into our country and stealing our things. missing animals, burnt down houses- blame them!” It’s so easy to do. The tension is already there. You just need to get their time changers. 

Except now, now a few of your weapons don’t come back. And Soltryce will only give you a few teenagers every few years. And they take so long to train, and you have to be somewhat nice to them until they kill their parents. But toddlers? Children under 10? They’re so much easier to manipulate. Less torture too, easier to scare into doing things. So he kidnaps a few children, Novgorod is a large town and no one will mind. except people do mind- but without him even doing, the people blame Xhorhas and its so easy to take more. and more. and more. 

And yet you still don’t have any results, you can’t let the government know you’ve been sending people across the border- they’re bad but you’d still be fired and possibly prosecuted, so you need something big. So you let some Xhorhasians get through, get deeper behind the border than they’ve ever been. Let them destroy your tower, steal the thing, and after they have made such a spectacle you kill them and take it back- except neither have it. So you scry, and find your old weapon in an inn basement, curled up with it next to a skeleton. you know Caleb is a broken man, you knew he had escaped and let him. You also know he’s a coward, and won’t get involved in this war. So you let him keep it, there is nothing you can get from the thing now. 

With the Tower broken, it only takes a bit more to tip over the scales. A few “attacks” on the city of Bladegarden and war is declared. And you will have what you need from the Xhorhasian capital. 

You just need some backing from some high-end support- and a powerful rich businessman who just had a son is exactly the type you need.

Less torture too, easier to scare into doing things. So he kidnaps a few children, Novgorod is a large town and no one will mind. except people do mind- but without him even doing, the people blame Xhorhas and its so easy to take more. and more. and more.

summary: I love the little cartoon animations on Handbooker Helper. [Gif description: Sumalee Montano says “So, no harm, no foul. Other...
body:
I love the little cartoon animations on Handbooker Helper.

[Gif description: Sumalee Montano says “So, no harm, no foul. Other than you know, not noticing that thing you missed.” while a cartoon of a hand holding a green poison covered dagger emerges from behind her.}]

summary: Came for the books ... stayed for the company. A messy Mighty Nein drawing that has been sitting on my computer for a while now....

summary: Do you remember what episode Beau got the letter from her parents about her brother? Matt just told her there was a letter for...
question: Do you remember what episode Beau got the letter from her parents about her brother? Matt just told her there was a letter for her at the cobalt soul and she read it silently
answer: I don’t actually remember her getting any letter from her parents?? The only letter I remember her getting from Matt was Keg’s. I got the feeling that when Beau told Fjord about getting a letter she was talking pre-stream. I could be wrong, though, so if anyone knows please give me a heads-up?

reblog.comment: I don’t actually remember her getting any letter from her parents?? The only letter I remember her getting from Matt was Keg’s. summary: Nott is a mother, she has a baby back in Felderwin.
title: Nott is a mother, she has a baby back in Felderwin.
body:
So Nott is fascinating as all hell right now, and I’ve spent a lot of time kinda contemplating her motives and the clues of her past, and I think I’ve pieced together the clues that the archfey known as Sam Riegel has placed.

I think that Nott has a baby back with Yeza in Felderwin.

Sounds wild, yeah? Let’s explore this possibility.

Obviously, there is a lot of evidence of Nott’s maternal instincts and habits, and there is also the fact that she literally called herself Caleb’s parent to The Mighty Nein. Maybe that’s just personality traits, sure, but in conjunction with some of my other ideas, this could be more telling.

Now, call to mind their days off in Zadash.

Both times, Nott sends a package away, including a collection of items and notes.

The first package is in Episode 16, A Favor in Kind, and she sends a package, specifically to Felderwin, which includes buttons, rings, a note, and most tellingly, a BRASS BABY BOTTLE.

The Second package, sent in Episode 31, Commerce & Chaos, is a tad more low key, but I find it notable that Sam mentions that he sent the letter Nott was sending away to Matt, meaning he probably wrote that thing out. I think it is almost certain that this was also sent to Felderwin.

Next, remember when Jester was talking to Nott about romance, back in Episode 41, A Pirate’s Life for Me?

Jester asks Nott if she has ever kissed a boy, and Nott says she has. When Jester presses for more, Nott is cagey as absolute fuck and really deflects the questions back on Jester. Then she starts suggestively describing what kisses are like when she’s pressing Jester for answers instead.

Finally, we come to recent events, where The Mighty Nein learn of how the Xhorhas incursions are striking into Felderwin and Kamordah. Nott downplays it, but she’s worried and confirms that she has a friend, likely Yeza the halfling man, back home in Felderwin that she wants to make sure is ok.

I think that Yeza and Nott are a couple, and that Yeza is the father of Nott’s child. Between the deflection and cageyness of details, the brass baby bottle, and the maternal instincts, I think this is very, very possible if not outright likely.

That begs the question though? What would that baby look like?

Honestly? Who knows? But I have a theory about that.

I think that it is very possible that the baby looks very much like a halfling as opposed to a goblin. Why do I think that? Well, I think so because it would give Nott another reason to go out looking to become a halfling.

Imagine, Nott and Yeza, a newborn baby finally starting to see the world, and when the baby’s eyes fall upon it’s mother, it is terrified of her goblin visage.

I think Nott was finally driven to look for something to change herself by the fact that her own child was frightened of her goblin nature, a final, massive straw breaking the back of an already wounded camel.

So Nott ventured out into the world and happened upon a wizard with dreams of changing reality, and so she joined this wizard, so that he could change her reality, and give her the happy life with her child and her lover she craves so badly.

Is it Thursday yet?

That begs the question though? What would that baby look like?

Honestly? Who knows? But I have a theory about that.

I think that it is very possible that the baby looks very much like a halfling as opposed to a goblin. Why do I think that? Well, I think so because it would give Nott another reason to go out looking to become a halfling.

Imagine, Nott and Yeza, a newborn baby finally starting to see the world, and when the baby’s eyes fall upon it’s mother, it is terrified of her goblin visage.

I think Nott was finally driven to look for something to change herself by the fact that her own child was frightened of her goblin nature, a final, massive straw breaking the back of an already wounded camel.

So Nott ventured out into the world and happened upon a wizard with dreams of changing reality, and so she joined this wizard, so that he could change her reality, and give her the happy life with her child and her lover she craves so badly.

Is it Thursday yet?

summary: I’m working on a modern day widomauk fic and granting Jester the ability to text is my greatest mistake bc now the whole story...
body: I’m working on a modern day widomauk fic and granting Jester the ability to text is my greatest mistake bc now the whole story is being derailed in favor of me just having her bombard Caleb with obnoxious text messages every 8 seconds and I am having way too much fun with this.

summary:
" Loss is excruciating.  Loss is paralyzing. Loss is inevitable.
Loss can bring sorrow, bring hate, bring cruelty, and darkness....
body:
“ Loss is excruciating. Loss is paralyzing. Loss is inevitable.

Loss can bring sorrow, bring hate, bring cruelty, and darkness.

Loss can instead teach you what is important. It offers perspective. It offers focus.

Might.

The courage to protect what has not yet been lost.

To be alone, to push others away, can prevent loss. But it prevents growth, strength, purpose.

How much-How many will you lose before you find your stregnth? ”

Critical Role - Campaign 2 ep 46: A storm of memories

Timestamp approx 1:30:00
